page.title: 03HOUSING.
page.content:
The majority of houses belongs to the Spencer estate,although some have been sold and at least one rented by a firm based in Northampton.There are a couple of derelict houses.
Most buildings are constructed of local sandstone and several are thatched.(The village thatcher is now retired).Some houses are of considerable age.One in Harlestone has a sundial on its outside wall.
The most unusual style of house is the row of wooden cottages(Swedish Houses) in Harlestone built as council housing in 1951.
There are two sets of railway cottages built to house"fog men" who worked on the nearby railway.
